decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. Breya, Etherium Shaper serves as the commander, providing a versatile win condition and additional removal options. The mana base is optimized for color fixing and consistency, allowing the deck to cast its spells efficiently. The deck includes powerful control cards like Cryptic Command, Force of Will, and Wrath of God to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck features a variety of artifact ramp and card advantage engines to ensure it can maintain control of the game and come out on top in the end.

This deck revolves around using Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to control the game by utilizing a plethora of instant and sorcery spells. The key strategy involves generating mana through cards like High Tide and Sapphire Medallion to cast spells efficiently, while also taking advantage of extra turn spells to gain tempo and outpace opponents. The deck includes a variety of card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Fact or Fiction to ensure consistency and find key pieces. Additionally, counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command provide protection and disruption. The end game can be reached through powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Promised End or by overwhelming opponents with disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on a control strategy, aiming to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up card advantage. The deck includes a wide array of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The commanders, Vial Smasher the Fierce and Kraum, Ludevic's Opus, provide additional card advantage and damage potential, allowing for a flexible and adaptable game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color identity and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through efficient and powerful spells, ultimately achieving victory through attrition and control.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage spells while also dealing damage through direct burn spells and efficient creatures. The commanders, Vial Smasher the Fierce and Kraum, Ludevic's Opus, provide a consistent source of damage and card draw. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and includes a variety of dual lands to ensure smooth mana fixing. The spells in the deck are chosen for their versatility and efficiency, allowing the player to adapt to different situations and maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure to close out the game quickly.

The deck revolves around utilizing Breya, Etherium Shaper's ability to generate thopter tokens and control the board with a variety of powerful spells. This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain control of the game. It includes a wide range of versatile spells such as Cryptic Command, Supreme Verdict, and Demonic Tutor to handle various threats. The mana base is diverse to ensure access to all colors needed to cast spells efficiently. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to provide additional control and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through strong control elements and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing Breya, Etherium Shaper's abilities to control the game and outvalue opponents. It includes a mix of artifact ramp, card draw, and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage. The deck also incorporates a package of powerful artifacts such as Stoneforge Mystic and Umezawa's Jitte to provide additional threats and utility. With a strong mana base and a toolbox of versatile spells like Demonic Tutor and Transmute Artifact, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents by adapting to various board states and resource situations. Its key strength lies in its ability to control the pace of the game and dictate the flow of interactions to secure victory.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan using a variety of removal spells, hand disruption, and board wipes. The deck aims to slowly grind the opponent out of resources while generating card advantage through cards like Liliana of the Veil, Necropotence, and Dark Confidant. The deck has a strong late-game with powerful threats like Griselbrand, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Wurmcoil Engine to close out the game. It also has various ways to generate mana advantage with lands like Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth, as well as mana rocks like Sol Ring and Thran Dynamo. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the board and outvaluing the opponent to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on a versatile and aggressive playstyle by utilizing the combination of Vial Smasher the Fierce and Kraum, Ludevic's Opus as commanders. The deck includes a wide array of powerful spells, disruption, and removal cards to control the game and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a strong control package featuring counterspells and removal spells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also dealing damage through Vial Smasher's ability. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage, along with versatile threats like Torrential Gearhulk and Goblin Dark-Dwellers. By combining aggression with control elements, the deck is able to adapt to different situations and outmaneuver opponents.
